House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service Discharged by Unanimous Consent.
Called up by House by Unanimous Consent.
Received in the Senate, read twice, and referred to the Committee on Judiciary.
Committee on Judiciary. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.
Committee on Judiciary. Reported to Senate by Senator Thurmond favorably without amendment and with a preamble. Without written report.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under Regular Orders. Calendar No. 49.
Passed Senate without amendment and with a preamble by Voice Vote.

official_title: A joint resolution to authorize and request the President to issue a proclamation designating May 3 through May 10, 1981, as "Jewish Heritage Week".

summary.text: Requests the President to designate the week of May 3 through May 10, 1981, as "Jewish Heritage Week."

titles.title: A joint resolution to authorize and request the President to issue a proclamation designating May 3 through May 10, 1981, as "Jewish Heritage Week".
